FuncDef:
The igmp snooping static-router-port command configures current sub-interface as a static router port.
The undo igmp snooping static-router-port command restores the default configuration. The igmp snooping static-router-port command configures current sub-interface as a static router port. The undo igmp snooping static-router-port command restores the default configuration. By default, a dynamic router port is used. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: igmp snooping static-router-port qinq pe-vid <pe-vidValue> ce-vid <ce-vidValue>
undo igmp snooping static-router-port [ dot1qvid <vidValue> | qinqpe-vid <pe-vidValue> ce-vid <ce-vidValue> ]
ParentView: 100GE Layer 2 sub-interface view,200GE Layer 2 sub-interface view,400GE Layer 2 sub-interface view,50GE Layer 2 sub-interface view,Eth-Trunk Layer 2 sub-interface view,Layer 2 sub-interface view

ParaDef.Info:
Enables dot1q encapsulation to allow a Layer 2 sub-interface to receive packets each with one or more tags.
-

Specifies a range of VLAN IDs for single-tagged packets to be received by a Layer 2 sub-interface.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Enables QinQ encapsulation to allow a Layer 2 sub-interface to receive packets with two or more tags.
-

Specifies an outer VLAN ID for double-tagged packets to be received by a Layer 2 sub-interface.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

Specifies a range of inner VLAN IDs for double-tagged packets to be received by a Layer 2 sub-interface.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.

ExtraInfo: If user hosts need to receive multicast data packets from a port for a long period of time, the igmp snooping static-router-port command can be used to configure the port as a static router port.
